diagnosis.final_diagnosis: High-grade dysplasia associated with fundic gland polyposis in familial adenomatous polyposis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Two large high-grade dysplasia lesions were found in the gastric body against a background of fundic gland polyposis. Genetic analysis revealed somatic APC mutations in both high-grade dysplasia lesions, indicating development as an FAP-related complication through biallelic inactivation of APC. Histological findings and mutation profiles suggest potential histogenetic linkage between fundic gland polyps and high-grade dysplasia.
